linmin_test.cpp

Minimizes a function of "N" variables. Performs a minimization of a function of variables, i.e. given as input the vectors and and the function , the function finds the scalar that minimizes . is replaced by and by .

Parameters:
p N-dimensional initial starting point for the search, is set to the point where the function takes on a minimum.
xi N-dimensional search direction, is replaced by the actual vector displacement that p was moved.
fret The function value at the new point p.
func The function that will be minimized.
Returns:
none.
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that p is not one-dimensional or that p has not the same size than xi
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1998
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
dlinmin.cpp

00052 #include <iostream>
00053 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00054 #include "LinAlg/arrayoptimize.h"
00055 
00056 
00057 using namespace std;
00058 
00059 
00060 // The testfunction: 
00061 double testfunc(const Array< double >& x)
00062 {
00063     return x(0) * x(0) + 2;
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 int main()
00068 {
00069     double          fret(0.); // function value at the point that
00070                               // is found by the function
00071     Array< double > p(1),     // initial search starting point
00072                     xi(1);    // direction of search
00073 
00074     // Initialize search starting point and direction:
00075     p(0) = -3.;
00076     xi(0) = 3.;
00077 
00078     cout << "Performing a line minimization for function f(x) = x*x + 2 "
00079          << "with starting point (-3, 11) and direction (3, 11):" 
00080          << endl << endl;
00081 
00082     // Minimize function:
00083     linmin(p, xi, fret, testfunc);
00084 
00085     // Output of results:
00086     cout << "x-value of final point:           ";
00087     writeArray(p, cout);
00088     cout << "y-value of final point = minimum: ";
00089     cout << fret << endl;       
00090     cout << "starting point has moved to the   " << endl
00091          << "predefined direction by:          ";
00092     writeArray(xi, cout);
00093 
00094     return 0;
00095 }
